required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Oral Febuxostat in Subjects With Gout
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Multicenter, Allopurinol-Controlled Study Assessing the Safety and Efficacy of Oral Febuxostat in Subjects With Gout

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare febuxostat allopurinol in subjects with gout.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized, double-blind, multicenter, allopurinol-controlled and parallel-assigned study comparing 40 mg, 80 mg of febuxostat, and allopurinol 300 mg in subjects with gout. Subjects will receive treatment for 24 weeks.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Whose Last Three Serum Urate Levels Are <6.0 Milligram Per Deciliter (mg/dL)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Last 3 visits (any last 3 visits up to week 28)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Whose Serum Urate Levels Are <6.0 mg/dL at Final Visit

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Serum Urate Levels at Final Visit
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Final Visit (up to 28 weeks)

arm_group.description: Febuxostat 40 mg, orally, once daily for up to 24 weeks
Febuxostat 80 mg, orally, once daily for up to 24 weeks
Allopurinol 100mg, orally, three times daily for up to 24 weeks

overall_official.affiliation: The Second Affiliated Hospital of Shantou University Medical College
The First Hospital of Shanxi Medical University
Ruikang Hospital Affiliated to Guangxi University of Chinese Medicine
